title: Predicting the Long-Term Light Stability of Color Photographic Prints: Comparing Macro and Micro-fade Testing Results
content: Since its introduction by P. Whitmore [1, 2], micro-fading test (MFT) has offered cultural heritage institutions the ability to assess the unique light stability of individual holdings, with the benefit of being a quasi-nondestructive test method that targets exposure to selected spots of interest on an object. A microscopic spot is exposed for a short duration at a high light intensity, and its impact is carefully controlled to be indiscernible. This technique has been widely practiced in cultural heritage institutions to assess the risks and identify light-fugitive objects requiring special care when displayed or loaned [3].
